intro: Pleiocarpidia assahanica, commonly known as the Assahanica pleiocarpidia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the genus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
